meanings.definition: The act of splitting or breaking apart into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: The fissioning of the cookie into two halves was quick.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the fissioning of cells to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The fissioning of the jigsaw puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: The fissioning of the team into smaller groups improved communication.
meanings.sent5: The loud fissioning of the thunder scared the little child.

meanings.definition: The process of undergoing nuclear fission.
meanings.sent1: Nuclear power plants rely on the controlled fissioning of atoms for energy.
meanings.sent2: The fissioning of uranium atoms releases a tremendous amount of energy.
meanings.sent3: The fissioning of the cake batter in the oven created a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: The fissioning of the star led to a spectacular explosion in space.
meanings.sent5: The fissioning of the atom bomb changed the course of history.

meanings.definition: The action of dividing or separating into two or more parts.
meanings.sent1: The fissioning of the road into two lanes reduced traffic congestion.
meanings.sent2: During cell division, the fissioning of chromosomes ensures accurate replication.
meanings.sent3: The fissioning of the argument into smaller points helped clarify the issue.
meanings.sent4: The fissioning of the river into multiple streams created a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The fissioning of the company into separate departments improved efficiency.
